channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2023090821
item.description:

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023090843
item.description:
Report E-2023090843

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of grease remover had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon can had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090263
item.description:
Report X-2023090263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the top/ side of the package was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the package was placed in a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report I-2023090080
item.description:
Report I-2023090080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T00:32:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-22
  • City: Seattle
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A PASSENGER'S LAPTOP BATTERY ONBOARD A COMMERCIAL FLIGHT WAS OVERHEATED AND LETTING OFF SOME SMOKE. THE LAPTOP WAS PLACED IN A BATTERY CONTAINMENT BAG ONBOARD THE AIRCRAFT. THE PASSENGER EXPERIENCED BURNS ON HIS HANDS BUT HOSPITALIZATION WAS NOT REQUIRED.
